title: How to Handle a Large Wine or Whiskey Cellar Fast
metaTitle: Handling Large Wine Cellars Fast | Liquidation Guide | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Strategies for triaging, documenting, and selling a large wine or whiskey cellar quickly. Don't waste time on detailed spreadsheets.
summary: Triage, batching, and submission formats that speed up quotes and reduce back and forth.

sections.heading: Quick Answer
content: Handling 500+ bottles does not mean you need to type 500 lines of data. Speed comes from smart triage.
list: Focus on the top 20% of bottles (the most valuable) first.
Take panoramic and shelf photos instead of moving bottles.
Send the photos for a rough estimate before detailed listing.
Use dictation or scanning apps if a list is mandatory.

sections.heading: The 80/20 Rule of Inventory
content: In most cellars, 80% of the value is in 20% of the bottles. Identify the 'Growths' (Bordeaux), 'Grand Crus' (Burgundy), or 'Age Statements' (Whiskey). List these in detail. The rest can be grouped as 'Misc Red Wine' or 'Table Wine'.

sections.heading: Batch Photography
content: Do not photograph single bottles unless they are over $500 in value. Instead:
list: Photograph spines as they sit in the rack (left to right, top to bottom).
Pull boxes out and photograph the end-labels.
Group loose bottles on a table in rows of 10 and take one clear shot.

sections.heading: What We Don't Need
content: Save yourself hours by skipping these details in your initial collection:
list: Exact ABV percentages (unless it's cask strength whiskey).
Back label reviews or importer text.

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
content: The biggest mistake is 'Analysis Paralysis'â€”trying to be perfect and never starting.
list: Creating a manually typed spreadsheet for 1,000 cheap bottles.
Googling every single bottle (retail prices are misleading).

sections.heading: What to Do Next
list: Take 5-10 overview photos of the collection.
Highlight the 3 most expensive brands you see.
Text or email them to us for an instant ballpark.
We can send a team to pack and inventory if the value warrants it.

faqs.question: Can you come inventory it for me?
faqs.answer: For qualified large collections (typically $25k+ value), we can arrange an on-site visit to inspect and pack.

faqs.question: How do I ship 50 cases?
faqs.answer: We arrange freight transport on a palette. You don't need to box them individually if we use palette shipping.

faqs.question: What is a 'large' cellar?
faqs.answer: Typically 300 bottles or more. We handle collections up to 10,000+ bottles.

faqs.question: Do I need to clean the bottles?
faqs.answer: No. Dust is fine. Cleaning often damages labels. Leave them as they are.

faqs.question: How long does a quote take for large cellars?
faqs.answer: Usually 48 hours. We use software to process photos/lists quickly.
